Explanations about Options.--addmode(M):
output name
 Add a mode to the set of valid modes for an output.
Explanations about Options.--mode(M): This selects a mode. Use either the name or the XID for mode
Explanations about Options.--output(M): Selects an output to reconfigure. Use either the name of the output or the XID.
Explanations about Options.--query(M):
When this option is present, or when no configuration changes are requested, xrandr
 will display the current state of the system.
Explanations about Options.-s(C): To add a short cut, in the Keyboard Shortcut settings, click add, choose a name, like 'First Resolution', a command like "xrandr -s 0", and hit Apply. You can now use "xrandr -s 0" to "xrandr -s 3" to change to one of them.
Explanations about Options.-s(M):
This sets the screen size, either matching by size or using the index into the list
 of available sizes.

Explanations about Options.-D(M): Hide window manager decorations, by using MWM hints.
Explanations about Options.-K(M):
Do not override window manager key bindings. By default rdesktop attempts to grab
 all keyboard input when it is in focus.
Explanations about Options.-P(M):
Enable caching of bitmaps to disk (persistent bitmap caching). This generally
 improves performance (especially on low bandwidth connections) and reduces network
 traffic at the cost of slightly longer startup and some disk space. (10MB for
 8-bit colour, 20MB for 15/16-bit colour, 30MB for 24-bit colour and 40MB for 32-bit
 colour sessions)
Explanations about Options.-g(M):
Desktop geometry (WxH[@DPI][+X[+Y]]). If geometry is the special word "workarea",
 the geometry will be fetched from the extended window manager hints property
 _NET_WORKAREA, from the root window. The geometry can also be specified as a
 percentage of the whole screen, e.g. "-g 80%", "-g 80%x70%".
Explanations about Options.-p(M):
The password to authenticate with. Note that this may have no effect if "Always
 prompt for password" is enabled on the server. WARNING: if you specify a password
 on the command line it may be visible to other users when they use tools like ps.
 Use -p - to make rdesktop request a password at startup (from standard input).
Explanations about Options.-u(M): Username for authentication on the server.
